answerText: Geoffrey of Monmouth (or Galfridus Monemutensis)[10] Shakespeare, like many other writers of his day, relied on this man's Chronicles of England, Scotland, and Ireland when writing his historically based works.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Editors 2 | 18 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] Perhaps the earliest known version of the King Lear story appears in the Historia Regum Britanniae, a work of this 12th century chronicler.
